name: Immortal Honey
the-point: Honey is the only food that never spoils; edible honey was found in 3,000-year-old Egyptian tombs.

name: Strawberry Logic
the-point: Botanically, strawberries are not berries, but bananas, pumpkins, and watermelons are.

name: Apple Air
the-point: Apples float because they are 25% air.

name: Spicy Pain
the-point: The 'heat' in chili peppers is a chemical reaction (capsaicin) that triggers pain receptors, not actual heat.

name: Fake Wasabi
the-point: Most 'wasabi' served in restaurants is actually just dyed horseradish.

name: Original Carrots
the-point: Carrots were originally purple; the orange variety was bred in the 17th century.

name: Nutmeg Hallucinations
the-point: In large quantities, nutmeg acts as a hallucinogen due to a compound called myristicin.

name: McDonald's Gold
the-point: McDonald's is the world's largest distributor of toys.

name: Ketchup Medicine
the-point: In the 1830s, ketchup was sold as a medicine to treat indigestion and diarrhea.

name: Chocolate Currency
the-point: The Aztecs and Mayans used cacao beans as a form of money.

name: Popsicle Invention
the-point: The popsicle was invented by an 11-year-old boy who left a soda mix outside overnight in 1905.

name: Egg Freshness
the-point: A fresh egg will sink in water, while an old egg will float due to the air pocket growing over time.

name: The Expensive Mushroom
the-point: White truffles can cost over $3,000 per pound because they cannot be cultivated; they must be found by dogs or pigs.

name: Vanilla Source
the-point: Natural vanilla comes from a specific type of orchid that must be hand-pollinated.

name: Cucumber Hydration
the-point: Cucumbers are 96% water, making them the most hydrating solid food.

name: Garlic Breath
the-point: Garlic breath comes from compounds that enter your bloodstream and are exhaled through your lungs.

name: Sound and Taste
the-point: Food tastes different on an airplane because the loud noise and low humidity reduce your sensitivity to sweet and salty flavors.

name: Cilantro Soap
the-point: For some people, cilantro tastes like soap because of a specific genetic variation in their olfactory receptors.

name: Potato Satellites
the-point: Potatoes were the first vegetable ever grown in space.

name: The Sandwich Origin
the-point: The sandwich was named after the Earl of Sandwich, who wanted a meal he could eat without leaving his gambling table.

name: Peanut Dynamite
the-point: Peanut oil can be processed to produce glycerol, which is a key ingredient in nitroglycerin.

name: Pineapple Tongue
the-point: Pineapples contain bromelain, an enzyme that breaks down proteins; essentially, the pineapple eats you back while you eat it.

name: Coffee Beans
the-point: Coffee beans aren't actually beans; they are the pits (seeds) of a cherry-like fruit.

name: Lemon Sugar
the-point: Lemons contain more sugar than strawberries, but their high citric acid masks the sweetness.

name: Cheese Addiction
the-point: Cheese contains caseomorphins, which trigger the same dopamine receptors in the brain as certain addictive substances.
